718738f-a.text:
(1)
333-331 Cherry Street, (rear view) south side, between Montgomery and Clinton Streets. The passageway was formerly occupied by No. 335 a
warehouse.
March 23, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view showing mainly No. 333, and the afore mentioned clearance.
March 23, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

718740f-a.text:
Cherry Street, south side, west from Montgomery Street. Note the vacant lot (No. 335), adjoining the 1-story white building.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A later view of the same area and :howing further
demolition of buildings beyond the aforementioned white garage, No. 339. The lower portion of this block was formerly developed as the Seventh Ward Athletic Field and is just beyond the 83-story structures. Upon demolition of buildings,this was included.
June 1, 1939
L. Snerr
718740f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Montgomery Street, Manhattan, NY

718741f-a.text:
Cherry Street, east from Montgomery Street. Views 2 d 3 are of the same area several aonths later and show the absence of a 5 story tenement appearing at the left of the earlier view. This is a white structure and bore No. 378. View No. 3 is in the same direction from a point slightly above Montgomery Street and across same. Note the East Side mothers taking advantage of the Spring sun to air their babies.
No. 1 April 25, 1939
2 & 3 June 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr
718741f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Montgomery Street, Manhattan, NY
